greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of iterations of x -> A252463(x) needed before the result is deficient, when starting from x=n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
example: For n = 945, the first odd abundant number, the iteration of A252463 proceeds as 945 -> 120 -> 60 -> 30 -> 15 -> 6 -> 3 -> 2 -> 1. From 945 to 30, all are nondeficient (sigma(k) >= 2k), and only at 15 we encounter the first deficient number, as sigma(15) = 24 < 2*15. Therefore a(945) = 4.
program: A064989(n) = {my(f); f = factor(n); if((n>1 && f[1,1]==2), f[1,2] = 0); for (i=1, #f~, f[i,1] = precprime(f[i,1]-1)); factorback(f)};
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 08 2020
